CAPTION FIGS2.png:
'

**Figure S2, Related to Figure 3.**

(A and B) Fluorescence microscopy of unroofed cell stained with a membrane dye (CellMask) (A) and phalloidin (B).

(C) Platinum replica EM of unroofed cell.

(D-F) Fluorescence staining of unroofed cell with clathrin antibody (D) and phalloidin (E) shown as individual grey-scale images and as a merged image (F) of the boxed region in F. Examples of CCSs associated with F-actin puncta (boxes 1-6 in F) are enlarged at right.

(G) Platinum replica EM of unroofed cell showing an overview of the ventral membrane. CCSs of different shapes are pseudocolored in yellow. Many of them are associated with dendritic actin patches, which are clearly distinguishable from the lamellar cytoskeleton on the background.

CAPTION FIGS3.png:
'

**Figure S3, Related to Figures 3 and 4.**

(A) Stereo images of CCS-associated actin patches in unroofed cells shown in main Figure 3.

(B-D) Stereo images of CCS-associated actin patches shown in Figure 4. Use red-cyan anadylph glasses with red eye at left to view 3D images.

'
CAPTION FIGS4.png:
'

**Figure S4. Effects of Actin Depolymerizing Drugs on Actin-CCS Association, Related to Discussion**

Cells were treated for 30 min with 5 \(\mu\)M latrunculin B (A and B) or 2 \(\mu\)g/ml cytochalasin D (C and D), extracted for 3 min with 1% Triton X-100 in PEM buffer and fixed with 4% PFA for fluorescence microscopy or 2% glutaraldehyde for EM.

(A and C) Immunofluorescence staining of clathrin (green) and phalloidin staining of F-actin (red). Individual numbered CCSs are zoomed in at bottom in corresponding panels.

(B and D) Platinum replica EM of drug-treated cells shows CCSs associated with remaining branched actin filament networks.

'
